translation.en: -[people speaking indistinctly] -[laughs]
-[woman] Yeah, Ma! -[crowd cheering]
[man] Yeah, baby!
♪ Hmm… ♪ ♪ Hmm… ♪
Testing, testing, one, two, three.
Testing, one, two, three.
-Testing, testing, one, two-- -Got that list?
Uh, I got it. Don't worry about it.
I'm holding you responsible. You keep her in line.
I'm not putting up with any shenanigans. You hear, Irv? Irv?
translation.ko: 헛짓거리는 용납 안 해 알았나, 어빈?

translation.en: Irv?
Irv!
Not putting up with any Royal Highness, Queen of the Blues bullshit.
Mother of the Blues, Mel. Mother of the Blues.
Heh. You should've heard Levee at the club last night, Toledo.
Trying to talk to that gal Ma had with her.
translation.ko: 마가 데리고 있는 여자애한테 말 걸려고 난리더군

translation.en: You ain't got to tell me. I know how Levee do.
translation.ko: 레비가 어떤 놈인지는 나도 잘 알지

translation.en: Levee tried talking to her and got his feelings hurt.
I want you to get her in here,
record those songs on that list, and get her out.
-Just like clockwork. -[doorbell buzzes] Like clockwork, Mel.
And that horn player, the one who gave me those songs,
translation.ko: 나한테 자작곡을 줬던 그 트럼펫 연주자도

translation.en: is he going to be here today?
-I want to hear more of that sound. -How you boys doing, Cutler?
[Cutler] Fine, Mr. Irvin.
Where's Ma? She with ya? I don't know.
She told us to be here at 1:00. That's all I know.
Where's the, uh, horn player?
Levee's supposed to be here same as we is. I reckon he'll be here in a minute.
translation.ko: 레비도 오기로 했어요 아마 곧 올 겁니다

translation.en: Hey, hey, hey. Good morning, Chicago.
-[both chuckling] -[woman] He ain't from 'round here now.
Come on in. I'll get you fed and ready to make some music. [Cutler] Right.
Right down the hall.
Where's Ma? How come she isn't with the band?
Everything's under control, Mel. I got everything under control.
translation.ko: 걱정 마세요, 멜 알아서 잘하고 있습니다

translation.en: Cutler, here's the list of songs we're going to record.
[Mel] Why isn't she here? And where's that horn player?
translation.ko: 마는 왜 없어? 트럼펫 연주자는 어딨고?

translation.en: What we got there, Toledo?
Eh, we got, uh…
Mmm. "Prove It on Me," "Hear Me Talking to You,"
translation.ko: '프루브 잇 온 미' '히어 미 토킹 투 유'

translation.en: "Ma Rainey's Black Bottom," "Moonshine Blues."
Oh. Them ain't the songs Ma told me.
I wouldn't worry about it if I was you. Ma'll get it straightened out.
translation.ko: 너무 신경 쓰지 마 마가 알아서 하겠지

translation.en: [Cutler] "Moonshine Blues."
That's one of them songs Bessie Smith sang, I believes.
translation.ko: 이건 베시 스미스가 부른 노래 같은데

translation.en: Eh, Slow Drag's right. I wouldn't worry about it.
translation.ko: 슬로 드래그 말이 맞아 신경 꺼야지

translation.en: Levee know what time he's supposed to be here?
Levee left the hotel talking about he was gonna buy shoes.
translation.ko: 아까 호텔 나가면서 구두 사러 간다고 하더군

translation.en: Says it's the first time he beat you shooting craps.
-I ain't thinking about no four dollars. -[Slow Drag] Levee sure was.
[Toledo] Let me get a hit of that.
[Slow Drag] That four dollars liked to burn a hole in his pocket.
He's supposed to be here at 1:00.
-That's some good Chicago bourbon. -[Levee] Look here, Cutler!
translation.ko: - 시카고 버번 맛 좋네 - 보세요, 커틀러!

translation.en: -[in sing-song] I got me some shoes. -[Slow Drag] Ooh!
Nigga, I ain't studying you.
[Toledo] How much you pay for something like that, Levee?
Eleven dollars. Four dollars of it belong to Cutler.
Ooh! Levee say if it wasn't for Cutler, he wouldn't have no new shoes.
translation.ko: 레비가 커틀러 덕분에 새 구두 장만했네

translation.en: I ain't thinking about Levee or his shoes.
-[laughing] -[Cutler] Let's get ready to rehearse.
translation.ko: 난 전혀 모르는 일이야! 이제 연습 준비하자

translation.en: [Slow Drag] I'm with you on that score. Don't want to be here all night.
[Toledo] Ain't but four songs on the list.
Last time there was six songs. Yeah. Now I'm ready.
I can play some good music now.
Damn! They done changed things around. Don't never leave well enough alone.
translation.ko: 젠장, 문이 생겼잖아 멀쩡한 걸 왜 바꾸는지 몰라

translation.en: Yeah, everything changing all the time. Even the air you breathing change.
translation.ko: 세상은 늘 바뀌지 들이쉬는 공기도 바뀌어

translation.en: Yeah, you got, uh, monoxide, hydrogen, changing all the time.
Skin changing. Different molecules. Everything.
translation.ko: 사람 피부도 바뀌어 분자가 변한다나, 다 변해

translation.en: Nigga, what is you talking about?
I'm talking about the room, I ain't talking about no skin and air.
translation.ko: 방 얘기 하는데 피부랑 공기가 왜 나와요?

translation.en: I'm talking about something I can see. I ain't talking about no molecules.
translation.ko: 분자 같은 거 말고 눈에 보이는 거 말이에요

translation.en: I know what you talking about. You don't know what I'm talking about.
translation.ko: 난 네 말 이해되는데 넌 날 이해 못 하냐?

translation.en: That door. You see that door? That's what I'm talking about.
translation.ko: 저 문 안 보여요? 저거 말하는 거잖아요

translation.en: Door wasn't there before.
You wouldn't know your right from left. And damn if that door wasn't there.
translation.ko: 좌우도 분간 못 하는 자식이 문이 있었는지 기억한다고?

translation.en: If you talking about they done switched rooms, you right.
But don't go telling me that door wasn't there.
Damn the door and let's do this. I want to get out of here.
translation.ko: 문 얘기 좀 그만해 얼른 연습하고 나가야지

translation.en: Toledo started all that about the door. I'm just saying that things change.
translation.ko: 문 얘기는 털리도가 꺼냈어요 난 세상이 바뀐다고만 했지

translation.en: What you think I was saying? Things change. The air and everything.
translation.ko: 내가 뭐라고 했냐? 세상은 늘 바뀐다고 했잖아

translation.en: Now you gonna say you was saying it.
You gonna fit two propositions on the same track,
translation.ko: 기차 두 대를 같은 철길에 올려놓고

translation.en: run them into each other, and 'cause they crash,
you gonna say it's the same train?
-Now this nigga talking about trains. -[Cutler laughs]
We done went from the air to the skin to the door and now trains.
translation.ko: 공기, 피부, 문 얘기 하다가 기차까지 나와요?

translation.en: Toledo, I'd just like to be inside your head for five minutes
translation.ko: 털리도, 그 머릿속에선 무슨 일이 일어나는 건지

translation.en: just to see how you think.
You done got more shit piled up and mixed up in there
-than the devil got sinners. -[laughing]
You been reading too many goddamn books.
What you care about how much I read?
translation.ko: 내가 책을 얼마나 읽든 뭔 상관이냐?

translation.en: I'm gonna ignore you 'cause you're ignorant.
-Let's rehearse the music. -All right.
You ain't gotta rehearse that. Ain't nothing but old jug-band music.
translation.ko: 연습할 필요 없어요 저그 밴드 수준 곡들이라

translation.en: They need one of them jug bands for this.
Don't make no difference to me, long as we get paid.
translation.ko: 돈만 쥐여 주면 뭘 못 해?

translation.en: That ain't what I'm talking about. I'm talking about art.
What's drawing got to do with it?
Where you get this nigga from, Cutler?
He sound like one of them Alabama niggas.
It's Slow Drag, all right. Just play the piece, nigga.
translation.ko: 슬로 드래그가 저렇지, 뭐 어서 연주나 해

translation.en: If you want to be one of them, uh, what you call virtuosos or something,
translation.ko: 혹시 거장 흉내를 내고 싶은 거라면

translation.en: you're in the wrong place.
You ain't no King Oliver or Buddy Bolden.
translation.ko: 넌 킹 올리버도 버디 볼든도 아니고

translation.en: You're just an old trumpet player come a dime a dozen.
translation.ko: 이 바닥에 널리고 널린 트럼펫 연주자일 뿐이니까

translation.en: Talking about art.
What is you? I don't see your name in lights.
translation.ko: 아저씨는 뭔데요? 아저씨도 대단할 것 없잖아요

translation.en: I just play the piece. Whatever they want. I don't criticize other people's music.
translation.ko: 남의 음악 평가 안 하고 부르면 가서 연주하는 놈이지

translation.en: I ain't like you, Cutler. I got talent.
-Oh, shit. -Ooh.
Me and this horn, we's tight.
If my daddy had a knowed I was gonna turn out like this, he woulda named me Gabriel.
translation.ko: 우리 아버지가 미리 알았다면 이름을 개브리엘로 지었을걸요?

translation.en: I'm gonna get me a band and make me some records.
translation.ko: 난 밴드 차려서 음반 낼 거예요

translation.en: I done give Mr. Sturdyvant some of my songs I wrote,
and he say he gonna let me record them when I get my band together.
translation.ko: 밴드만 구해 오면 녹음시켜 준다고 했거든요

translation.en: I just gotta finish the last part of this song.
I knows how to play real music, not this old jug-band shit.
translation.ko: 저그 밴드나 하는 이런 곡 말고 진짜 곡을 만들 줄 안다고요

translation.en: I got style.
Oh, everybody got style.
Style ain't nothing but keeping the same idea from beginning to end.
translation.ko: 처음부터 끝까지 일관성을 유지하면 그게 스타일이야

translation.en: Everybody got it.
Everybody can't play like I do. Everybody can't have their own band.
translation.ko: 나처럼 실력이 좋거나 자기 밴드 가진 사람은 드물죠

translation.en: Until you get your own band where you can play what you want,
translation.ko: 네 밴드 차려서 원하는 곡 연주하기 전까진

translation.en: play the piece and stop complaining.
I told you when you came on here, this ain't none of them hot bands.
translation.ko: 우린 톡톡 튀는 밴드 아니라고 첫날에 얘기했지?

translation.en: This is an accompaniment band. You play Ma's music when you're here.
translation.ko: 우린 반주 밴드야 마의 노래만 연주하면 돼

translation.en: I got sense enough to know that.
I could look at y'all and see what kind of band it is.
translation.ko: 딱 봐도 어떤 밴드인지 감 오죠

translation.en: I could look at Toledo and see what kind of band it is.
translation.ko: 털리도 아저씨 보면 감이 딱 온다니까요

translation.en: Oh, now Toledo ain't said nothing to you. Don't get Toledo started now.
translation.ko: 내가 너한테 뭐라 했냐? 아저씨 건드리지 마라

translation.en: Is you all gonna rehearse the music or ain't you?
How many times you done play them songs?
-What you gotta rehearse for? -This a recording session.
I want to get it right the first time and get on out of here.
translation.ko: 한 번에 제대로 끝내고 퇴근하면 좋잖아

translation.en: Well, y'all go on and rehearse, then.
I'm going to finish this song for Mr. Sturdyvant.
translation.ko: 난 스터디밴트 씨 드릴 곡 마저 쓸 거니까

translation.en: Levee, I don't want no shit. You rehearse like everybody else.
translation.ko: 레비, 까불지 말고 우리랑 같이 연습해

translation.en: You in the band just like everybody else.
Mr. Sturdyvant gonna have to wait. It's the band's time.
translation.ko: 작곡은 나중에 해 지금은 밴드 시간이야

translation.en: I'm ready if you want to rehearse. I said there ain't no point in it.
translation.ko: 누가 연습 안 한대요? 연습할 이유가 없다고 했지

translation.en: Ma ain't here. What's the point?
"Ma Rainey's Black Bottom." One, two, you know what to do.
translation.ko: '마 레이니스 블랙 보텀' 하나, 둘, 들어갑시다

translation.en: No, no, no. No, no. We ain't doing it that way.
We doing my version. That's what Mr. Irvin told me.
translation.ko: 내 버전으로 해요 어빈 씨도 그러랬어요

translation.en: Say it's on the list he gave.
Let me worry about what's on the list.
What sense it make to rehearse the wrong version?
You supposed to rehearse what you gonna play.
-That's the way they taught me. -That's what I'm trying to say.
You trying to tell me what we is and ain't gonna play,
and that ain't none of your business.
Your business is to play what I say. Oh. I see now.
translation.ko: - 넌 내가 시키는 대로나 해 - 이제 알겠다

translation.en: You done got jealous 'cause Mr. Irvin using my version.
[scoffs] What I got to be jealous of you about?
The day I get jealous of you, I may as well lay down and die.
translation.ko: 널 질투할 바에는 콱 죽어버리고 말지

translation.en: Levee started all that 'cause he too lazy to rehearse.
translation.ko: 연습하기 싫어서 수작 부리는 거 아니야?

translation.en: Where's the paper? Look at the paper. See what it say.
translation.ko: 리스트 어딨어요? 뭐라고 적혀 있는지 봐요

translation.en: Gonna tell me I'm too lazy to rehearse.
[Cutler] We ain't talking about the paper.
We talking about you understanding where you fit in here.
translation.ko: 네가 자기 주제를 아는 게 더 중요하지

translation.en: -You play what I say. -I don't care what you play.
Mr. Irvin gonna straighten it up. I don't care what you play.
translation.ko: 어빈 씨가 알려줄 거니까 멋대로 생각하라고요

translation.en: You boys know what's keeping Ma?
Can't say, Mr. Irvin. She'll be along directly, I reckon.
translation.ko: 저희도 잘 모르겠네요 아마 곧 올 겁니다

translation.en: Well, you go ahead.
Mr. Irvin… [chuckles] About these songs…
Whatever's on the list.
I'm talking about this "Black Bottom."
-It's on the list. -Yes, sir, I know it's on the list.
But I just want to know which version. We got two versions of that song.
translation.ko: 두 가지 버전이 있는데 어떤 걸로 할까요?

translation.en: Oh, Levee's version. We're using Levee's arrangement.
translation.ko: 레비 버전이죠 저 친구 편곡으로 해요

translation.en: [Cutler] Okay, got that straight. Now about this "Moonshine Blues."
Yeah, we'll work it out with Ma, Cutler.
You boys just rehearse whatever's on that list.
See, I told you!
It don't mean nothing when I say it. You got to wait for Mr. Irvin to say it.
translation.ko: 내 말은 귓등으로도 안 듣고 어빈 씨한테 물어보더니

translation.en: I told you the way it is.
The sooner you understand it ain't what you say,
translation.ko: 아직도 모르나 본데 네 말은 중요하지 않아

translation.en: or what Mr. Irvin say, it's what Ma say that count.
translation.ko: 어빈 씨가 뭐라 하든 마가 하라는 대로 할 거야

translation.en: I don't care what you play. Don't matter to me.
translation.ko: 하고 싶은 대로 해요 난 신경 안 써요

translation.en: Mr. Irvin gonna straighten it up. I don't care what you play.
translation.ko: 어빈 씨가 정리해 줄 거니까 맘대로 하라고요

translation.en: Thank you. All right, let's, uh, play this "Hear Me Talking to You"
translation.ko: 고맙다, 일단 '히어 미 토킹 투 유'부터 하지

translation.en: till we figure out what's going on with this "Black Bottom."
One, two, you know what to do.
Don't nobody say when it comes to Ma. She gonna do what she wanna do.
translation.ko: 마는 누가 뭐라고 하든 자기 뜻대로 하는 사람이야

translation.en: Mr. Irvin the one putting out the record.
He gonna put out what she want him to put out.
Levee confused about who the boss is. He don't know Ma's the boss.
translation.ko: 레비가 혼란스러운가 봐 마가 대장이란 걸 몰라

translation.en: You know how many records she sold in New York?
And you know what's in New York? Harlem. Harlem's in New York.
translation.ko: 할렘이 있는 뉴욕에서 몇 장이 팔렸냐고요

translation.en: [Slow Drag] So what if they didn't sell in New York?
We packed them in in Memphis, Birmingham, Atlanta.
We ain't in Memphis. We in Chicago. We in a recording session.
Mr. Sturdyvant and Mr. Irvin say what's gonna be here.
You heard what the man told you.
"Ma Rainey's Black Bottom." Levee's arrangement.
translation.ko: '마 레이니스 블랙 보텀' 레비 편곡으로 간다

translation.en: There you go. That's what he told you.
I don't know why y'all want to pick with me about it.
translation.ko: 왜 나만 못살게 구는지 영문을 모르겠네

translation.en: I'm with Slow Drag. Let's go and get it rehearsed.
All right, "Ma Rainey's Black Bottom," Levee's version.
translation.ko: 좋아, '마 레이니스 블랙 보텀' 레비 버전으로

translation.en: [Toledo] How that first part go again there, Lev?
It go like this.
That's to get the people's attention.
That's when you and Slow Drag come in with the rhythm,
me and Cutler play on the breaks.
The man asked how the part go. Ain't ask for all that.
"Ma Rainey's Black Bottom."
One, two, you know what to do.
Hey, hey, hey. Y'all gotta keep up now. You playing in the wrong time.
Will you let us play this song? We been playing before you was born.
translation.ko: 그냥 놔두면 안 되겠냐? 한참 어린 후배 놈이

translation.en: Trying to tell us how to play.
All right. Let's try again.
Wait a minute. Let me fix this.
This string starting to unravel,
and you know I want to play Levee's music right.
translation.ko: 레비 곡을 제대로 연주할 수 있지 않겠어?

translation.en: If you was any kind of musician, you'd take care of your instrument.
translation.ko: 제대로 된 뮤지션이라면 악기를 잘 관리하셔야죠

translation.en: Keep it in tip-top order.
If you was any kind of musician, I'd let you be in my band.
translation.ko: 제대로 된 뮤지션이라면 내 밴드에 넣어줄 텐데

translation.en: -Shit. -Damn!
Slow Drag, watch them big-ass shoes you got.
Ain't nobody done nothing to you.
You done stepped on my shoes. Then move them out the way.
You was in my way. I wasn't in your way.
Any man who takes a whole week's pay and puts it on some shoes,
understand what I mean,
what you walk around on the ground with, is a fool.
And I don't mind telling him.
What difference it make to you?
Ain't nothing wrong with having nice shoes.
-Look at Toledo. -[Levee] Ooh!
What?
What was that about Toledo?
Nigga got them clodhoppers. Old brogans.
translation.ko: 저 촌스러운 신발 좀 보게 낡은 작업화 신은 소작농인 줄 알겠네

translation.en: He ain't nothing but a sharecropper.
translation.ko: 낡은 작업화 신은 소작농인 줄 알겠네

translation.en: Hey, Slow Drag.
Play something for me.
A man gotta have some shoes to dance like this.
translation.ko: 이쁘장한 구두를 신어줘야 이런 스텝이 나오지

translation.en: He can't dance like this with them clodhoppers Toledo got.
That's the trouble with colored folks, always looking to have a good time.
translation.ko: 흑인은 이게 문제야 늘 즐기려고만 하지

translation.en: More niggas have got killed trying to have a good time
than God got ways to count.
What the hell having a good time mean? That's what I want to know.
translation.ko: 애초에 즐긴다는 게 뭔데? 누가 설명해 봐

translation.en: Got to be more to life than just having a good time.
translation.ko: 즐기며 사는 게 인생의 전부는 아니잖아

translation.en: If there ain't, then this is a piss-poor life we're living
translation.ko: 아무것도 남기지 않고 그저 즐기다 간다면

translation.en: if that's all there is to be got out of it.
Niggas been having a good time before you was born,
and they gonna keep having a good time after you gone.
Nobody talking about making the lot for the colored man better for him here in America.
translation.ko: 흑인들 삶을 개선할 방법을 의논할 생각은 눈곱만큼도 없지

translation.en: Ain't nobody thinking about what kind of life, the world they gonna leave for the young'uns.
translation.ko: 후손들에게 살 만한 세상을 남겨줄 생각들을 안 해

translation.en: It's just, "Show me a good time. That's all I want."
Aw. It just makes me sick.
Good times is what makes life worth living.
Hey, I know how to have a good time as well as the next man.
translation.ko: 나도 즐길 줄 알아 옆에 있는 저놈만큼

translation.en: Yeah.
I just said there's got to be more to life than just having a good time.
translation.ko: 하지만 즐기는 것만이 인생의 전부는 아니라는 거야

translation.en: I said, the colored man ought to be doing more
translation.ko: 우리 흑인들은 더 열심히 살아야 돼

translation.en: than trying to have a good time all the time.
Well, what is you doing, nigga?
You're talking all them highfalutin ideas
about making a better world for the colored man.
What is you doing to make it better?
You playing the music and looking for your next piece of pussy same as we is.
translation.ko: 연주하고 여자 꼬시는 건 우리랑 똑같이 하고 살면서

translation.en: What is you doing?
It ain't just me, fool. I said everybody.
You think I'm gonna solve the colored man's problem all by myself?
translation.ko: 흑인들이 겪는 문제를 혼자서 해결할 수 있겠냐?

translation.en: I said "we." You understand that?
We? That's every living colored man in the world
translation.ko: '우리' 말이야 하늘 아래 있는 모든 흑인들이

translation.en: got to do his share, got to do his part.
translation.ko: 자기 몫을, 자기 역할을 하라는 거야!

translation.en: I ain't talking about what I'm gonna do or you gonna do,
translation.ko: 내 얘기도 아니고 네 얘기도 아니고

translation.en: or Cutler, Slow Drag, anybody else.
translation.ko: 커틀러, 슬로 드래그 그게 누구든 간에

translation.en: I'm talking about what all of us gonna do together.
translation.ko: 우리 모두 힘을 합쳐서 행동하자는 거야

translation.en: That's what I'm talking about, nigga.
Well, why ain't you just say that then?
Toledo, I don't know why you waste your time with this fool.
translation.ko: 저 자식 상대해 줘봤자 시간 낭비야

translation.en: I ain't gonna be too many more of your fools.
Ain't nobody studying you.
All right, I ain't nobody. Don't pay me no mind. Ain't nobody but the devil.
translation.ko: - 미천한 몸한테 신경 끄세요 - 미천한 악마겠지

translation.en: There you go. That's who I am. I'm the devil. I ain't nothing but the devil.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 제대로 보셨네 내가 바로 악마예요

translation.en: -I know a man sold his soul to the devil. -[all groan]
Name of Eliza Cotter. Lived in Tuscaloosa County, Alabama.
translation.ko: 앨라배마주 터스컬루사 출신 일라이자 코터라는 남자야

translation.en: Devil came by and he upped and sold him his soul.
Nigga, how you know this man done sold his soul to the devil?
translation.ko: 그 남자가 영혼을 팔았는지 네가 어떻게 아냐?

translation.en: You talking some old-woman foolishness.
Everybody know. It wasn't no secret.
He went around working for the devil and everybody knowed it.
translation.ko: 그렇게 영혼을 팔고 악마 밑에서 일했다더라고

translation.en: Carried him a bag. One of them carpet bags.
Folks say he carried the devil's papers and whatnot
where he put your fingerprint on the paper with blood.
translation.ko: 피로 지문을 찍어 바르는 계약서 같은 거 말이야

translation.en: Where he at now? That's what I want to know.
He can have my whole handprint if he want to.
translation.ko: 내 지문 싹 다 가져가라 해요

translation.en: Showed up one day all fancied out
in the finest clothes you ever seen on a colored man.
translation.ko: 그렇게 잘 차려입은 흑인은 처음 봤다는 거야

translation.en: Pocketful of money, just living the life of a rich man.
translation.ko: 두둑한 지갑을 들고 부티가 좔좔 흘렀다는군

translation.en: Had him a string of women he run around with
and throw his money away on.
One of the fellas of them gals he was messing with
got fixed on him wrong and Eliza killed him.
translation.ko: 자기 맘에 안 드니까 바로 죽여버리고는

translation.en: And laughed about it.
Sheriff come and arrest him and let him go.
Trial come up. Judge cut him loose.
Cut him loose -and give him a bottle of whiskey. -[Cutler whistles]
Folks ask what done happened to make him change,
and he tell them straight-out he done sold his soul to the devil
and asked them if they wanted to sell theirs, too,
'cause he could arrange it for them.
Hold on. What happened to this fella? That's what I want to know.
translation.ko: 지금 그 사람이 어떻게 됐는지 알고 싶군

translation.en: Last I heard, he headed up north with that bag of his,
translation.ko: 계약서가 든 가방을 들고 북부로 가서

translation.en: handing out $100 bills on the spot to whoever wanted to sign on with the devil.
Hmm. I sure wish I knew where he went.
He wouldn't have to convince me long.
Hell, I'd even help him sign people up.
Nigga, God gonna strike you down with that blasphemy you talking.
translation.ko: 이놈아, 불경한 말 입에 담다가 주님께 찍히는 수가 있어요

translation.en: Oh, shit. God don't mean nothing to me.
Let him strike me. Here I am, standing right here.
translation.ko: 여기 있으니까 어디 한번 찍어보라 해요

translation.en: What you talking about he gonna strike me? Here I am. Let him strike me. I ain't scared of him.
translation.ko: 무슨 소릴, 나 여기 있어요! 벌줘봐요, 안 무서우니까

translation.en: All right. You gonna be sorry.
You gonna fix yourself to have bad luck.
Ain't nothing gonna work out for you.
-Bad luck? -Yeah.
What I care about bad luck?
You talking simple.
I ain't had nothing but bad luck all my life.
Couldn't get no worse. What the hell I care about bad luck?
translation.ko: 더 나빠질 것도 없지 그딴 게 무섭겠어요?

translation.en: I eat it every day for breakfast.
You dumber than I thought you was, talking about bad luck.
translation.ko: 불운을 입에 담는 걸 보니 멍청하신 분이네

translation.en: All right, nigga.
You'll see. [chuckles]
Can't tell a fool nothing.
You'll see.
Oh. There you go.
Over there.
[man] What are you doing?
Cutler, your boys' sandwiches are here.
-Cutler? -[policeman] Lady--
-[Ma Rainey] This is a brand new car. -Lady-- Ain't had but a ding.
translation.ko: 이거 새 차야 흠집 하나 없었다고

translation.en: -Okay, lady-- -[Ma Rainey] What you gonna do?
-Ma! -[policeman] I'm talking--
[Ma Rainey] I got eyes, you got eyes. What are you gonna do?
-Listen to me-- -What happened?
Tell this man who I am. Get him straight.
Tell this man who he's messing with.
Officer, what's the matter? What's the problem?
When I walked up on the incident, this lady--
-Sylvester wrecked Ma's car. -I… I did not. The man hit me.
translation.ko: - 실베스터가 차를 박았어요 - 아냐, 저 사람이 박았어

translation.en: [policeman] You want it in a nutshell?
We got her charged with assault and battery.
-Assault and what for what? -Sylvester was driving--
I can tell you what happened if you wanna know.
That's my nephew. That's Sylvester. He was driving my car--
translation.ko: 저기 있는 내 조카가 내 차를 몰다가...

translation.en: -We don't know whose car it is. -That's Ma's car.
I bought and paid for that car.
That's what you say. We gotta check it out.
What's the problem?
I was calling the paddy wagon
to haul them to the station, sort everything out.
-She's aggressive with the other driver-- -He got ugly with me.
-I don't know why you tell that lie. -You let me tell the story?
Well, if you gonna tell it, tell it right.
Like I said, while I was waiting for the paddy wagon,
I turn to hear this guy's side of the story.
She won't let him get a word in edgeways.
He steps in front of her to tell his version of things,
she pushes him to the ground.
She ain't hit him. He just fell.
If that don't beat all to hell. I ain't touched the man.
translation.ko: 못 들어주겠네 난 아무도 안 건드렸어

translation.en: All right, Ma. Officer, can I speak to you for a minute?
translation.ko: 진정하세요 경관님, 잠시 얘기 좀 할까요?

translation.en: I got things to do.
He bumped into me and fell down. Flopping on the ground like a rag doll.
translation.ko: 저놈이 날 밀치다 넘어졌어 보릿자루처럼 흐느적거렸다고

translation.en: I ain't touch the man.
[Irvin] All right, Ma.
Come on. Let's go. Move it out.
I got it all taken care of.
Clear it out. Come on. Let's go.
What's going on? What did you do?
Sturdyvant, get on away from me. That's the last thing I need, to go through your shit.
translation.ko: 저리 가요 당신 상대할 기분 아니니까

translation.en: -[policeman] Everybody move along. -It's not the place.
Here, Ma.
Let me take your things.
-I don't believe we've met. -Hi.
That's my nephew Sylvester, and that there's Dussie Mae.
-Oh, hello. -[Ma Rainey] Everybody here?
They're in the band room.
-Ma, why don't you sit and relax? -I ain't for no sitting.
translation.ko: - 마, 잠깐 앉아서 쉬시죠 - 앉기 싫어

translation.en: -Where's the bathroom? -Uh, down that hall.
Honey, call down there and see about my car. I need my car fixed today.
translation.ko: 내 차 좀 어떻게 해봐 저거 오늘 고쳐야 해

translation.en: Why y'all keep it so hot in here?
Y'all want to make records, better get a fan on.
I got it, Ma. I'll take care of everything.
[Mel] She's late and already--
I talked to her last night. Got everything straight.
You stay out of the way. Let me handle it.
You handled it last time, remember?
She marches in like she owns the place, complains about the building being cold,
translation.ko: 주인처럼 거들먹거리며 들어와서는 건물이 춥다고 하질 않나

translation.en: trips over a mic wire, then threatens to sue me.
translation.ko: 마이크 줄에 걸려 넘어져 놓고 고소하겠다고 하질 않나

translation.en: I ain't never been in a recording studio.
Where the band at?
They off somewhere rehearsing.
Come over here and let me see that dress.
That dress look nice.
I'm gonna take you tomorrow to get you some things
before I take you down to Memphis.
They got some clothes up here they ain't got in Memphis.
translation.ko: 여기서 파는 옷들은 멤피스 가면 없거든

translation.en: -I want you to look nice for me, hmm? -Mmm-hmm.
You gonna travel with the show, you gotta look nice.
I just need me some new shoes. These hurt my feet.
Oh, don't you be messing around with no shoes that pinch your feet.
translation.ko: 발 아프게 하는 신발은 상종을 하면 안 돼

translation.en: Ma knows something about bad feet. Mmm.
[Ma Rainey] Okay.
Go on, get my slippers out my bag over yonder.
[sighs] I just want some of them yellow ones.
About a half size bigger.
We'll get you whatever you need. Sylvester too.
translation.ko: 원하는 건 다 사줄게 실베스터도 그렇고

translation.en: Sylvester, tuck your clothes in.
Straighten them up and look nice. Like a gentleman.
Look at Sylvester with that hat on.
[Ma Rainey] Take that hat off inside. Come over here and leave that piano.
translation.ko: 실내에선 모자 벗어야지 피아노 놔두고 이리 와

translation.en: [stammering] I ain't doing nothing to the… piano. I'm… l… looking at it.
translation.ko: 아무것도 안 했어요 그냥 보고 있었어요

translation.en: Baby, come over here and sit down. Come on.
Soon as Mr. Irvin come back,
I'm gonna have him take you down, introduce you to the band.
translation.ko: 널 밴드 친구들에게 소개하게 할 거고

translation.en: Cutler gonna show you how your part go.
When you get your money, send some of it home to your mama.
translation.ko: 오늘 돈 받고 나면 일부는 엄마한테 부쳐서

translation.en: -Let her know you're doing all right. -Okay.
Ma, I called down to the garage and checked on your car.
translation.ko: 마, 정비소에 연락해서 자동차 상태 확인했어요

translation.en: It's just a scratch, and they'll have it ready for you this afternoon.
They'll send it over with one of their fellows.
Better have my car fixed right.
I ain't going for that. Brand-new car. They better fix it like new.
translation.ko: 새 차였으니까 새 차처럼 고쳐놓으라고 해

translation.en: Irvin, what is that I hear?
I know they ain't rehearsing Levee's "Black Bottom."
I know I ain't hearing that.
Ma, it's what I wanted to talk to you about.
Levee's version, it really picks it up.
I ain't studying Levee nothing. I know what he done to that song.
translation.ko: 레비가 뭘 했든 관심 없어 저 노래에 한 짓을 봐

translation.en: I don't like to sing it that way. I'm doing it the old way.
translation.ko: 저렇게 부르는 거 싫어 원래대로 부를 거야

translation.en: That's why I brought my nephew in here to do the voice intro.
That's what people want now, Ma. They want something they can dance to.
translation.ko: 요즘은 사람들이 춤출 수 있는 곡을 원해요

translation.en: Levee's arrangement gives the people what they want.
translation.ko: 레비의 편곡이 그 욕구를 충족시켜 주죠

translation.en: It makes them excited, forget about their troubles.
I don't care what you say, honey. Levee ain't messing up my song.
translation.ko: 네가 뭐라고 하든 내 노래 망치게는 못 둬

translation.en: If he got what the people want, let him take it somewhere else.
translation.ko: 사람들이 그 곡을 원하면 다른 데서 연주하라고 해

translation.en: I'm singing Ma Rainey's song, not Levee's song.
translation.ko: 난 레비 노래 말고 내 노래 부를 거야

translation.en: Now that's all there is to it.
Carry my nephew on down there. Introduce him to the band.
translation.ko: 이제 내 조카 데려가서 멤버들한테 소개해

translation.en: I promised my sister I'd look out for him,
so he's gonna do the voice intro to the song my way.
translation.ko: 얘한테 인트로를 시킬 거야 내 방식으로

translation.en: [Irvin] We just figured--
Who's this "we"? What you mean "we"? Come talking this "we" stuff. Who "we"?
translation.ko: '우리'가 누구야? 내 앞에서 누굴 들먹이는 거야?

translation.en: Me and Sturdyvant. We decided-- You decided, huh? I'm just a bump on a log.
translation.ko: - 저랑 스터디밴트가 결정을... - 결정? 난 허수아비니까

translation.en: I'm just gonna go whichever way the river drift.
Is that it? You and Sturdyvant decided?
-No. We just thought-- -I ain't got no good sense.
I know nothing about music or what a good song is or what ain't.
translation.ko: 음악도 전혀 모르고 좋은 노래가 뭔지 모르고

translation.en: You know more about my fans than I do.
It's not that. It's more of what the people want.
translation.ko: 그 뜻이 아니에요 사람들이 그런 걸 원한다고요

translation.en: Tell you something, Irvin, and you can go up there and you can tell Sturdyvant too.
What you all say don't count with me, you understand?
translation.ko: 너희가 뭐라 하든 나한텐 안 중요해, 알아들어?

translation.en: Ma listen to her heart. Ma listen to the voice inside her.
translation.ko: 난 내 마음과 내면의 목소리를 들어

translation.en: That's what count with Ma.
Carry my nephew on down there.
Tell Cutler he'll do the voice intro to the "Black Bottom" song.
Levee ain't messing up my song.
If that don't set right with you and Sturdyvant,
I can carry my black bottom on back down South to my tour,
translation.ko: 내 검은 궁둥이 들고 남부로 돌아가서 공연할 거야

translation.en: 'cause I don't like it up here noways.
Okay, Ma.
I don't care.
-I just thought-- -Damn what you thought!
What you look like trying to tell me how to sing my song.
translation.ko: 당신들이 뭔데 내 노래를 맘대로 건드려?

translation.en: That Levee and Sturdyvant shit, I ain't going for it.
Sylvester, go introduce yourself. I'm through playing with Irvin.
translation.ko: 실베스터, 내려가서 인사해라 어빈이랑 얘기 끝났다

translation.en: Uh… Where I go? Which way they at?
Come on. I'll carry you down there myself.
Can I go? I want to see the band.
No. Come on, Sylvester.
Okay, Ma. Have it your way,
but we'll be ready to go in 15 minutes.
We'll be ready to go when Madam says so. That's the way it go around here.
translation.ko: 언제 할지는 내가 결정해 그게 여기 규칙이야

translation.en: Perfect.
Cutler, this here my nephew Sylvester.
He'll do the voice intro on "Black Bottom" using the old version.
translation.ko: '블랙 보텀' 원래 버전에서 인트로를 담당할 거야

translation.en: What? Mr. Irvin said we're using my version.
translation.ko: 무슨 소리예요? 어빈 씨가 내 곡으로 한댔는데

translation.en: I ain't studying you or Mr. Irvin.
Cutler, get him straightened out on how to do his part.
I ain't thinking about Levee.
These folks done messed with the wrong person.
Cutler gonna teach you how to do your part. Go ahead and get it straight.
translation.ko: 커틀러가 파트 알려줄 거니까 똑바로 배워놔라

translation.en: Don't worry about what nobody else say.
Hey, come on in, boy. I'm Cutler. [chuckles]
That's Toledo, Levee, and Slow Drag over there.
translation.ko: 이쪽은 털리도, 레비 저긴 슬로 드래그야

translation.en: -Sylvester, huh? -Sylvester Brown.
I wrote a version of that song,
what picks it up and sets it down in the people's lap,
and here she come talking this.
You don't need that old circus bullshit. I know what I'm talking about.
translation.ko: 케케묵은 인트로는 안 먹혀요 내가 안다니까요

translation.en: You gonna mess up the song, Cutler, and you know it.
translation.ko: 이러면 노래 망치는 거 커틀러도 알잖아요

translation.en: I ain't gonna mess up nothing. Ma say-- I don't care what Ma say!
translation.ko: - 안 망쳐, 마가... - 마가 뭐가 중요해요!

translation.en: I'm talking about what the intro gonna do to the song.
The peoples in the North ain't gonna go for that old tent-show nonsense.
translation.ko: 서커스 느낌의 인트로를 북부 사람들이 좋아하겠어요?

translation.en: -They wanna hear some music. -[Cutler] Nigga.
I done told you time and again. Ma say what to play, not you.
translation.ko: 대장은 네가 아니라 마야 몇 번을 말했냐?

translation.en: You ain't here to be doing no creating. You play whatever Ma say.
translation.ko: 넌 작곡가로 온 게 아냐 마가 시키는 대로 연주해

translation.en: I might not play nothing. I might just quit.
Nigga, don't nobody care if you quit. Whose heart you gonna break?
translation.ko: 네까짓 게 관둔다고 누가 속상해할 것 같아?

translation.en: Levee ain't gonna quit. He need to make money to keep him in shoe polish.
translation.ko: 레비가 관둘 리가 있나 구두 광내려면 돈 벌어야지

translation.en: I done told y'all you don't know me. You don't know what I'll do.
translation.ko: 다들 날 몰라서 그래요 내 재능을 모르네

translation.en: I don't think nobody give a damn. Sylvester, look here.
translation.ko: 내 알 바 아니고 실베스터, 잘 들어라

translation.en: The band plays the intro, and then you say,
translation.ko: 밴드가 인트로를 연주하면 이렇게 말하는 거야

translation.en: "All right, boys, you done seen the rest."
"Now I'm gonna show you the best."
"Ma Rainey's gonna show you her black bottom."
You got that? Heh. All right, let me hear you do it one time.
All right, boys, you done s… s… [stuttering]
…seen the rest.
Now I'm gonna show you the best.
Ma Rainey's gonna show you her black b… b… b…
…bottom.
[scoffs] All right, Cutler. Let me see you fix that.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 커틀러 저거 고칠 수 있겠어요?

translation.en: Straighten that out.
Slow Drag, whoo, you hear this shit?
How in the hell the boy gonna do the part if he can't even talk?
translation.ko: 말도 제대로 못 하는데 인트로를 어떻게 해요?

translation.en: [stuttering] Who… Who's you to tell me what to do, nigga?
This ain't your band. Ma tell me to d… do it, I'mma do it.
translation.ko: 이게 네 밴드인 줄 알아? 마가 하라는 대로... 할 수 있어

translation.en: So you can go to hell… n… n… nigga.
[mockingly] B… Boy, ain't nobody studying you. Cutler, go on and fix that.
translation.ko: 어째, 타격이 하나도 없네 커틀러, 고쳐봐요

translation.en: You fix that and I'll shine your shoes for you.
translation.ko: 저거 고칠 수 있으면 내가 구두 광내드리죠

translation.en: Go on and fix that one.
You say, uh, you Ma's nephew?
Yeah, so what that mean?
Oh, I ain't meant nothing. I was just asking.
Let's rehearse so the boy can get it right.
translation.ko: 애 잘할 수 있게 연습해 보자

translation.en: I ain't rehearsing nothing.
Just wait till I get my band together.
I'm gonna record that song and show you how it's supposed to go.
translation.ko: 이 곡을 어떻게 녹음해야 하는지 보여줄 거예요

translation.en: We can do it without Levee. Sylvester, you remember your part?
translation.ko: 레비는 빼고 하지 실베스터, 대사 기억나냐?

translation.en: Yeah, I… I remember pretty g… good.
Well, come on. Let's do it then. All right?
Levee.
Good, you boys are rehearsing, I see.
Yessir, we rehearsing. We know them songs real good.
translation.ko: 네, 연습 중입니다 워낙 잘 아는 곡들이라서요

translation.en: Good. Say, Levee, did you finish that song?
Yessir, Mr. Sturdyvant. I got it right here.
I wrote that other part just like you say. It go like…
Then I wrote that part for the other people to dance,
like you say, for them to forget about their troubles.
Good. I'll see about your songs as soon as I get the chance.
translation.ko: 좋아, 자네 곡들은 짬 나는 대로 들어보지

translation.en: -I'll just take this. -Yessir, Mr. Sturdyvant.
Soon as you get the chance.
[Cutler] You hear Levee? You hear this nigga? "Yessir, we's rehearsing, boss."
translation.ko: 저 자식 말 들었어? '네, 연습 중입니다!'

translation.en: I heard him. Seen him too. Shuffling them feet.
[Toledo] Yeah, well, Levee can't help it none.
He's spooked up by the white man. Ain't had time to study 'em.
translation.ko: 백인한테 바짝 쫄았네 겪어본 적이 있어야지

translation.en: I studies the white man, I got him studied good.
The first time one fixes on me wrong, I'm gonna show him just how much I study.
translation.ko: 나한테 한 놈 잘못 걸리면 본때를 보여줄 거라고요

translation.en: Come tell me I'm spooked up by the white man.
You let one mess with me, I'll show you how spooked up I am.
translation.ko: 백인이랑 싸움 붙여봐요 바짝 쫀 게 뭔지 보여줄게요

translation.en: The man come in here, call you a boy,
translation.ko: 저 양반이 와서 널 애송이 취급 하면서

translation.en: tell you to get up off your ass and rehearse,
and you ain't had nothing to say except, "Yessir!"
I can say "yessir" to whoever I please. What you got to do with it?
translation.ko: 내가 어떻게 대답하든 아저씨가 무슨 상관인데요?

translation.en: I know how to handle white folks. I been handling them for 32 years.
translation.ko: 나도 백인 다룰 줄 알아요 32년을 다뤄왔어요

translation.en: You gonna tell me how to do it?
Just 'cause I say "yessir," don't mean I'm spooked up by him.
translation.ko: 대답 한 번 깍듯이 하면 바짝 쫀 거예요?

translation.en: I know what I'm doing. Let me handle him my way.
translation.ko: 나도 눈치 있으니까 알아서 하게 둬요

translation.en: [Cutler] Well, go and handle it then.
Toledo, you always messing with somebody.
Always agitating somebody with that old philosophy bullshit.
translation.ko: 고상한 철학자 흉내 내면서 성질을 긁잖아요

translation.en: You stay out of my way about what I do and say.
translation.ko: 내 언행 두고 뭐라 하지 마요

translation.en: I'm my own person. Just let me alone.
All right, all right. Levee, you right. I apologize.
translation.ko: 그래, 알았어 네 말이 맞아, 미안하다

translation.en: Ain't none of my business you spooked up by the white man.
translation.ko: 네가 백인한테 바짝 쫀 게 나랑 뭔 상관이겠냐?

translation.en: -[all laughing] -See, that's the shit I'm talking about.
Y'all back up and leave Levee alone.
Oh, come on, Levee. We was all just having fun.
Toledo ain't said nothing about you he ain't said about me.
translation.ko: 이 친구가 너한테 한 말 나도 다 들어봤어

translation.en: You just taking it all wrong.
I ain't meant nothing by it.
Levee got to be Levee!
He don't need nobody messing with him about the white man!
translation.ko: 아무도 내 앞에서 백인 얘기 하지 말라고요!

translation.en: 'Cause you don't know nothing about me. You don't know Levee.
You don't know nothing about what kind of blood I got!
What kind of a heart I got beating here!
I was eight years old
when a gang of white mans come into my daddy's house
translation.ko: 백인 남자 무리가 우리 집에 들어와서

translation.en: and have to do with my mama any way they want.
We was living in Jefferson County, about eight miles outside of Natchez.
My daddy's name was Memphis. Memphis Lee Green.
translation.ko: 아버지 이름은 멤피스였죠 멤피스 리 그린

translation.en: Had him near 50 acres of good farming land. I'm talking good land.
translation.ko: 농지 6만 평을 소유했는데 아주 기름진 땅이라

translation.en: Grow anything you want.
He done gone off of shares and bought this land
translation.ko: 아버진 전 재산을 써서 그 땅을 샀어요

translation.en: from Mr. Hallie's widow woman after he done passed on.
translation.ko: 핼리 씨가 죽고 나서 그 부인에게서 샀는데

translation.en: Folks called him a uppity nigger 'cause he done saved and borrowed
translation.ko: 다들 건방진 깜둥이라고 했죠 열심히 돈 모으고 빌려서

translation.en: to where he could buy this land and be independent.
It was coming on planting time,
and my daddy went into Natchez to get him some seed and fertilizer.
translation.ko: 아버지는 씨앗과 비료를 사러 내치즈로 가시면서

translation.en: Called me, say, "Levee, you the man of the house now."
"Take care of your mama while I'm gone."
I wasn't but a little boy.
Eight years old.
My mama…
was frying up some chicken when them mans come in the house.
translation.ko: 놈들이 들이닥쳤을 때 닭을 튀기고 계셨어요

translation.en: Must have been eight or nine of 'em.
She's standing there frying that chicken when them mans come and took a hold of her
translation.ko: 놈들이 들어와서 닭 튀기던 어머니를 붙잡는데

translation.en: just like you take hold of a mule and make it do what you want.
There was my mama…
with a gang of white mans.
She tried to fight 'em off.
I could see where it wasn't gonna do her any good.
translation.ko: 아무 소용 없는 게 내 눈에도 보였어요

translation.en: I didn't know what they was doing to her,
but I figured whatever it was, they might as well do to me too.
My daddy had a knife he kept around there for hunting and working and whatnot.
And I knew where he kept it. I went and got it.
I'm gonna show you how spooked up I was by the white man.
translation.ko: 그때의 내 모습이 백인에게 바짝 쫀 모습이었죠

translation.en: I tried my damnedest to cut one of them's throat.
I hit him on the shoulder.
He reached back, grabbed hold of that knife, and whacked me across the chest with it.
translation.ko: 놈은 내 칼을 뺏어 들고 내 가슴을 그었죠

translation.en: That's what made them stop.
They was scared I was gonna bleed to death.
translation.ko: 내가 출혈로 죽을까 봐 겁이 났던 거죠

translation.en: My mama wrapped me in a blanket,
carried me two miles down to the Furlow place
and they drove me up to Doc Albans.
He was waiting on a calf to be born, and he say he ain't had time to see me.
translation.ko: 소가 새끼를 낳는 중이라고 날 봐줄 시간이 없다더라고요

translation.en: They carried me to Miss Etta, the midwife,
and she fixed me up.
My daddy came back
and acted like he done accepted the facts of what happened.
He got the names of them mans from Mama.
He found out who they was,
and then we announced we was moving out that county.
We said goodbye to everybody, all the neighbors.
My daddy went and smiled in the face of one of them crackers
translation.ko: 아버지는 어머니를 건드린 무리의 일원을 보고

translation.en: who had been with my mama.
Smiled in his face…
and sold him our land.
We moved over with relations in Caldwell.
translation.ko: 그리고 콜드웰에 있는 친척 집으로 갔는데

translation.en: He got us settled in,
and then he took off one day. I ain't never seen him since.
translation.ko: 어느 날 집을 떠났고 그 뒤로 볼 수 없었어요

translation.en: He sneaked back.
Hiding up in the woods,
laying to get them eight or nine men.
He got four of them before they got him.
They tracked him down in the woods.
Caught up with him, hung him…
set him afire.
My daddy wasn't spooked up by the white man. No, sir.
translation.ko: 아버지는 백인 앞에서 쫄지 않았어요, 절대로

translation.en: And that taught me how to handle them.
I seen my daddy go up and grin in this cracker's face.
translation.ko: 그 백인 놈 앞에서 씩 웃는 모습을 봤거든요

translation.en: Smile in his face and sell him his land.
All the while, he's planning how he's gonna get him
translation.ko: 속으로는 놈을 칠 계획을 짜고 계셨던 거예요

translation.en: and what he's gonna do to him.
That taught me how to handle them.
translation.ko: 난 그때 백인 다루는 법을 배웠죠

translation.en: So you all just back up and leave Levee alone about the white man.
translation.ko: 그러니까 아저씨들도 나한테 백인이 어쩌고 훈수 두지 마요

translation.en: I can smile and say "yessir" to whoever I please.
translation.ko: 지금은 얼마든지 웃어주고 깍듯이 대답해 주지만

translation.en: I got my time coming to me.
You all just leave Levee alone about the white man.
[Toledo] ♪ Everybody ♪
Everybody come from different places in Africa, right?
translation.ko: 모두가 아프리카 대륙 여기저기서 온 게 아닌가?

translation.en: Different tribes and things.
Soon awhile they began to make one big stew.
You had your, uh, carrots and your peas,
and your potatoes over here.
And over there, you had your meat and nuts,
uh, okra, corn.
And you mix it up, cook it real good to where the flavors flow through.
translation.ko: 잘 섞어서 요리해 주면 맛이 살아난단 말이야

translation.en: And then you got one thing.
You got a stew.
Now you take and you eat that stew.
You take and you make your history with that stew.
But you look around and you see some carrots over there,
translation.ko: 그런데 주변을 둘러보니 저기에 당근도 좀 남고

translation.en: and some peas over here.
And… that stew is still there.
Hmm. You done made your history and it's still there.
You can't eat it all. [laughs]
What you got?
You got some leftovers. That's what it is.
See, we's the leftovers. The colored man, he is the leftovers. Huh.
translation.ko: 우리가 바로 그 찌꺼기야 흑인이 곧 찌꺼기지

translation.en: What's the colored man gonna do with himself?
That's what we're waiting to find out.
But first he's got to know that he's a leftover.
translation.ko: 하지만 자신이 찌꺼기인 걸 먼저 깨달아야 해

translation.en: [Cutler] Mr. Irvin.
I ain't got nothing to do with it, but…
the boy can't do the part.
He stutters right through it every time.
It's a whole different bottom, though. It's a whole different style.
translation.ko: 하지만 이번엔 달라 완전히 다른 스타일이야

translation.en: [Cutler] Relax and breathe, and everything's gonna be all right.
translation.ko: 긴장 풀고 심호흡해 넌 잘할 수 있어

translation.en: I'm just gonna cue you in…
[Slow Drag] I know where the four is, man. Don't got to tell me nothing.
translation.ko: 네 번째 박자가 어딘지 안 알려줘도 돼

translation.en: [Cutler] You're gonna smile and say the line. Then we gonna get goin'.
translation.ko: 웃고 나서 대사 치면 곡이 시작되는 거야

translation.en: -Cutler. -Ma'am?
[Slow Drag] I know it's on the four…
Levee got his eyes in the wrong place. You better school him, Cutler.
translation.ko: 레비 눈 돌아가는 거 봐 애 단속 좀 시켜

translation.en: Come on, Levee. Let's get ready to play. Keep your mind on your work.
translation.ko: 레비, 녹음 준비 해야지 일에 집중하자

translation.en: Okay, boys. Here we go. Here we go. Here we go.
"Moonshine Blues" first. "Moonshine Blues," Ma.
I ain't doing no moonshine nothing. I'm doing "Black Bottom" first.
Come on, Sylvester. Where's Sylvester's mic? Irvin, get him a mic.
translation.ko: 실베스터 마이크 어디 있어? 어빈, 마이크 줘

translation.en: Uh… Ma, the boys say he can't do it.
Who? Who say he can't do it? What boys say he can't do it?
translation.ko: 누가? 누가 뭘 못 해? 그런 말을 누가 했어?

translation.en: The band, Ma. The boys in the band.
What band?
Band work for me.
[Irvin] He stutters, Ma. They say he stutters.
I don't care if he do.
I promised the boy he could do the part, so he gonna do it.
translation.ko: 이미 약속한 대로 애한테 인트로 시킬 거야

translation.en: And that's all there is to it. He don't stutter all the time.
translation.ko: 더 얘기할 것도 없어 말을 못 하는 것도 아니잖아

translation.en: Get a microphone down here for him.
We don't have time. We can't--
If you wanna make a record, find the time.
I ain't playing with you. I could walk out of here right now.
Go back to my tour. I don't need to go through all this.
translation.ko: 투어 하러 가도 돼 이러고 있을 필요 없어

translation.en: Go get the boy a microphone.
Levee, I know you had something to do with this. Watch yourself.
translation.ko: 레비, 네 수작인 거 알아 너 조심해라

translation.en: It was Cutler.
It was you. You the only one… [stuttering]
The boy stutter. He can't do the part.
Can or can't, he gonna do it.
-You ain't got nothing to do with it. -I don't care.
translation.ko: - 네가 결정할 게 아냐 - 맘대로 하세요

translation.en: -He can sing the whole song. -Well, all right. Thank you.
translation.ko: - 그냥 전곡을 부르라고 하지 - 그래, 고맙다

translation.en: He's only getting one chance. The cost of this--
translation.ko: 딱 한 번만 시킵니다 비용이 얼만데...

translation.en: Damn the cost. You always talking about the cost.
I make more money for this outfit than anybody else you got put together.
translation.ko: 당신 가수들 다 합쳐도 나만큼 돈 못 벌어요

translation.en: If he mess up, he'll do it till he get it right.
Come on, baby. Come on. Come.
Stand right there. Hold your hands like I told you to. Okay. Come on.
translation.ko: 여기 서서 내가 알려준 대로 손잡아

translation.en: All right. Don't worry about messing up.
You mess up, we'll do it till you get it right.
All right. Play it for him, Cutler.
All right.
One, two, you know what to do.
All right, boys,
[stuttering] you done seen the best.
Now I'm gonna show you the rest.
Ma Rainey's gonna show you her b… b… b…
black b… bottom.
That's real good, baby. You take your time. You'll get it right.
translation.ko: 아주 잘했어, 천천히 하면 돼 점점 나아질 거야

translation.en: [Irvin] Okay, Ma. We're ready to go.
-Where's my Coke? -"Ma Rainey's Black Bottom," boys.
Where's my Coke? I need a Coke. Hot as it is. Shit. I need a Coke.
translation.ko: 내 콜라 갖다줘 더워 죽겠네, 콜라 마셔야겠어

translation.en: What's the matter, Ma? Where's my Coke? I need a cold Coca-Cola.
Uh, Ma, look…
I forgot the Coke.
Let's do it without it, huh? Just this one song. What say, boys?
translation.ko: 콜라 없이 딱 한 곡만 합시다 밴드 분들은 어때요?

translation.en: Damn what the band say. You supposed to have my Coca-Cola. You knew that.
translation.ko: 밴드고 나발이고 코카콜라 있어야 되는 거 알잖아

translation.en: I ain't doing nothing without my Coca-Cola.
-Shit. -[Mel] Just a minute here, Ma.
You come in an hour late--
Get out my face. Irvin, I told you keep him away from me.
translation.ko: 당신은 저리 가요 어빈, 저 사람 치우라고 했어

translation.en: I'm tired of her nonsense. I'm not gonna put up with this.
translation.ko: 사람 시험하는 것도 아니고 더는 못 참아줘!

translation.en: Let me. Ma, listen.
I'll call down to the deli and get you a Coke. But let's get started.
translation.ko: 가게에 연락해서 콜라 준비할 테니 일단 합시다

translation.en: Sylvester's standing there ready to go, the band's all set up.
Let's do this one song.
Too cheap to buy me a Coca-Cola. I'll buy my own.
translation.ko: 구두쇠라 그것도 못 사주나 보네 내 돈으로 살게

translation.en: Slow Drag, Sylvester. Go on, baby.
Get me three bottles of Coca-Cola, ice cold. Get y'all something too.
translation.ko: 시원한 콜라 세 병이랑 다른 사람 마실 것도 사 와

translation.en: -Keep the change. -Yes, ma'am.
Irvin, get away from me. Shit.
You can wait till I get my Coca-Cola. Ain't gonna kill you.
translation.ko: 콜라 올 때까지 좀 기다린다고 안 죽어

translation.en: Okay, Ma. Get your Coke.
Gentlemen, the band room.
Christ sakes, get your Coke.
Cutler.
Come here a minute. I need to talk to you.
What's all this shit about "the boys in the band said"?
translation.ko: 밴드 멤버들이 왜 입을 놀리고 다니지?

translation.en: I tells you what to do.
I says what the matter is with the band. I say who can and can't do what.
translation.ko: 밴드에서 뭘 어떻게 할지는 오직 내가 결정하는 거야

translation.en: We just say 'cause the boy stutter.
I know he stutters. Don't you think I know?
This is what gonna help him. We thought it'd be easier--
He gonna do the part. I don't wanna hear any more of this shit
translation.ko: 인트로는 무조건 그 애가 할 거니까

translation.en: about what the boys in the band says.
translation.ko: 앞으로 한 번만 더 입 놀려봐

translation.en: And I want you to find somebody to replace Levee when we get to Memphis.
translation.ko: 그리고 멤피스에 가면 레비 대체할 사람 구해

translation.en: Levee ain't nothing but trouble. Levee all right.
He plays good music when he puts his mind to it.
translation.ko: 의지만 있으면 좋은 음악을 연주할 줄 알아요

translation.en: -He know how to write music too. -I don't care.
He ain't nothing but bad news.
Find somebody else. He the ringtail leader.
translation.ko: 다른 사람 찾아 그놈이 문제의 근원이야

translation.en: I know it was his idea who to say who can do what.
translation.ko: 내 결정에 토 다는 거 그놈 생각인 거 다 알아

translation.en: Dussie Mae! Sit your ass down and stop flaunting yourself around.
translation.ko: 더시 메이, 끼 부리지 말고 얌전히 앉아 있어

translation.en: I ain't doing nothing. Just go somewhere and stay out of the way.
translation.ko: - 아무 짓도 안 했어요 - 어쨌든 방해하지 말고 있어

translation.en: Hi. I just wanted to see what it look like down here.
translation.ko: 안녕하세요, 여기 어떻게 생겼나 궁금해서 와봤어요

translation.en: Well, come on in.
I don't bite.
I didn't know you could write music.
I just thought you was jiving me at the club last night.
translation.ko: 저번에 클럽에서는 허세 부리는 줄 알았거든

translation.en: No, baby. I knows how to write music.
translation.ko: 무슨, 당연히 곡 쓸 줄 알지

translation.en: I done give some of my songs to Mr. Sturdyvant.
He say he gonna let me record 'em.
I'm gonna have my own band.
Hey, Toledo. Ain't I give Mr. Sturdyvant some of my songs I wrote?
translation.ko: 털리도, 스터디밴트 씨가 제 곡 가져간 거 봤죠?

translation.en: Don't get Toledo mixed up in nothing.
You gonna have your own band, sure enough?
-Levee Green and his Footstompers. -[giggles]
A man what's gonna get his own band need to have a woman like you.
translation.ko: 나만의 밴드를 만들려면 너 같은 여자가 필요한데

translation.en: A woman like me need a man to bring it and put it in my hand.
translation.ko: 나 같은 여자가 필요하면 구미 당기는 제안을 하셔야지

translation.en: I don't need nobody getting something for nothing
and leave me standing in my door.
That ain't Levee's style, sugar. I knows how to treat a woman.
translation.ko: 그건 내 스타일이 아니지 난 여자 대하는 법을 알거든

translation.en: Buy her presents and things. Treat her like she want to be treated.
translation.ko: 선물도 사주고 원하는 대로 대해줄 거야

translation.en: That's what they all say till it come time to be buying the presents.
translation.ko: 다들 그렇게 얘기해 놓고 선물은 안 사주더라

translation.en: When we get down to Memphis, I'm gonna take you out,
translation.ko: 멤피스에 가면 내가 좋은 곳에 데려가 줄게

translation.en: show you a good time.
Show you Levee know how to treat a woman.
Ma.
This "Moonshine Blues," that's one of them songs that Bessie Smith sangs, I believe.
Bessie what? I ain't thinking about Bessie.
translation.ko: 베시 누구? 내가 걔를 왜 신경 써?

translation.en: Shit. I taught Bessie. Bessie ain't doing nothing but imitating me.
translation.ko: 내가 가르친 애야 걔가 나 따라 한 거야

translation.en: What I care about Bessie? I don't care if she sell a million record.
translation.ko: 걔가 백만 장을 팔아도 나랑은 상관없는 얘기지

translation.en: She got her people. I got mine. I don't care what nobody else do.
translation.ko: 각자 알아서 하는 거야 남이 뭘 하든 상관 안 해

translation.en: Ma was the first. Don't you forget it.
Nobody said nothing about all that.
-I'm saying that's the song she sang. -I've been doing this a long time.
Ever since I was a little girl. I don't care what nobody else do.
translation.ko: 이 일을 해오면서 남 눈치는 본 적 없어

translation.en: Shoot. That's what get me so mad with Irvin.
translation.ko: 젠장, 이래서 어빈을 보면 화나는 거야

translation.en: White folks try to be put out with you all the time.
Too cheap to buy you a damn Coca-Cola.
I lets them know it, though. Ma don't stand for no shit. Shoot.
translation.ko: 그래서 허튼수작 부리지 말라고 일부러 강하게 나가는 거야

translation.en: They wanna take your voice and trap it in all them fancy boxes
translation.ko: 버튼이랑 다이얼 달린 화려한 라디오 박스 안에

translation.en: with all them buttons and dials, and then too cheap to buy you a Coca-Cola.
translation.ko: 내 목소리 가둘 생각은 하면서 콜라 한 병을 안 사다 놔?

translation.en: Don't cost but a nickel a bottle.
They don't care nothing about me.
All they want is my voice.
Well, I done learned that.
And they gonna treat me the way I want to be treated
translation.ko: 내 꼬장 때문에 놈들이 괴로워한다고 해도

translation.en: no matter how much it hurt 'em.
They back there right now calling me all kinds of names.
translation.ko: 아마 저 뒤에서 나에게 온갖 욕을 퍼붓고 있겠지

translation.en: Calling me everything but a child of God.
But they can't do nothing else 'cause they ain't got what they wanted yet.
translation.ko: 내게 원하는 게 있으니 날 함부로 대할 수 없어

translation.en: As soon as they get my voice down on one them recording machines,
translation.ko: 저 기계에 내 목소리를 녹음하고 나면

translation.en: then it's just like I'd be some whore and they roll over and put their pants on.
translation.ko: 내가 창녀라도 되는 것처럼 바지 주섬주섬 입고 퇴장할 거야

translation.en: They ain't got no use for me then.
I know what I'm talking about. You watch.
And Irvin, he right there with the rest of them.
He don't care nothing about me either.
translation.ko: 내가 어떻게 되든 신경 안 써

translation.en: He's been my manager for six years, and the only time he had me over his house
translation.ko: 6년간 매니저 노릇 했는데 자기 집에 딱 한 번 초대해서는

translation.en: was to sing for some of his white friends. Huh. I know how they do.
Yeah. Shit, you colored and you can make 'em some money,
then you all right with them, otherwise you just a dog in the alley.
translation.ko: 사람 취급 해주지만 그게 아니면 그냥 골목의 개야

translation.en: I done made them more money from my records
than all them other recording artists they got put together,
translation.ko: 내 음반으로 번 돈이 훨씬 많은데

translation.en: and then they wanna balk about how much this session is costing them.
I can't see how it's costing as much as they say.
translation.ko: 비용이 뭐 그리 많이 든다는 건지 모르겠어요

translation.en: Shit, it ain't. I don't pay that kind of talk no mind.
translation.ko: 많이 안 들어 그래서 난 듣는 척도 안 하잖아

translation.en: -I already got my fellas picked out. -Mmm-hmm.
I'm getting me some good fellas. Know how to play real sweet music.
translation.ko: 달콤한 연주를 할 줄 아는 실력 좋은 친구들이지

translation.en: You get your own band, we'll see about this stuff you talking.
translation.ko: 일단 밴드부터 만들어 그러고 나서 얘기해

translation.en: I just wanna show you I knows what the womens like.
translation.ko: 난 여자가 뭘 좋아하는지 잘 안다니까

translation.en: They don't call me Sweet Lemonade for nothing.
Stop it now. Somebody gonna come in here. No, they ain't.
Look here, sugar.
What I wants to know is,
can I introduce my red rooster to your brown hen.
translation.ko: 내 검붉은 수탉을 네 갈색 암탉에게 소개해 줄까?

translation.en: You get your own band and we'll see if your red rooster know how to crow.
translation.ko: 네 밴드 만들어서 오면 쓸 만한 수탉인지 알 수 있겠네

translation.en: [Levee] Mmm. Damn, baby.
Now I know why my grandpappy sat on the front porch
translation.ko: 왜 우리 할아버지가 할머니 빨래 널 때마다

translation.en: with a straight razor when my grandma hung out the wash.
translation.ko: 면도날 들고 경계 섰는지 이제야 알겠군

translation.en: You crazy!
I bet you sound like the midnight train to Alabama
translation.ko: 자긴 분명 앨라배마행 심야 열차가 메이슨·딕슨선을 넘으면서 울리는

translation.en: when it crosses the Mason-Dixon Line.
[Dussie Mae] How you get so crazy?
It's women like you that drive me so…
-Good God. -[laughing]
Happy birthday to the lady with the cakes.
Sure done got quiet in here.
I never could stand no silence.
I always got to have some music going on in my head somewhere.
It keeps things balanced. Music will do that. It fills things up.
translation.ko: 음악은 균형을 잡아주고 빈 곳을 채워주지

translation.en: The more music you have in the world, the fuller it is.
translation.ko: 음악이 흘러넘칠수록 세상은 더 채워지는 거야

translation.en: I can agree with that. I got to have my music too.
translation.ko: 동감이에요 저도 음악 없이 못 살죠

translation.en: White folk don't understand about the blues.
They hear it come out, but they don't know how it got there.
translation.ko: 들을 줄은 알아도 어떻게 탄생한 줄은 모르지

translation.en: They don't understand that that's life's way of talking.
translation.ko: 블루스에 우리 인생이 담겨 있다는 걸 몰라

translation.en: You don't sing to feel better.
You sing 'cause that's a way of understanding life.
The blues help you get out of bed in the morning.
translation.ko: 블루스는 아침에 눈을 뜰 수 있게 도와주지

translation.en: You get up knowing you ain't alone.
There's something else in the world.
Something's been added by that song.
This be an empty world without the blues.
Yeah.
I try to take that emptiness and fill it up with something.
translation.ko: 난 그 공허함을 무언가로 채우는 사람이지

translation.en: I ain't started blues way of singing. Blues always been there.
translation.ko: 블루스는 내가 시작한 게 아냐 늘 이 세상에 존재했어

translation.en: But if they wanna call me the Mother of Blues,
that's all right with me. It don't hurt none.
translation.ko: 난 좋다 이거야, 나쁠 거 없지

translation.en: Sure did take y'all a long time. Sylvester, get Irvin.
Tell him we ready to go. I'll grab Levee.
Ma got her Coke, Levee. We about ready to start.
translation.ko: 콜라 사 왔어, 레비 녹음 들어갈 거야

translation.en: -[Levee whispers] Get this off me. -[Dussie Mae] Okay.
-[Levee whispers] Okay, gotta go. -[Dussie Mae whispers] Just go!
Okay, boys. "Ma Rainey's Black Bottom," take one.
Two, you know what to do.
All right, boys, you… you… d… done…
Take two.
All right, boys,
you done seen the rest. Now I'm gonna show you the best.
Ma Rainey's gonna show you her… B… B… B…
Take…
Ma, can we just do it without the…
Take six.
Take seven.
All right, boys,
you done seen the rest. Now I'm gonna show you the best.
Ma Rainey's gonna show you her black bottom.
Okay, that's good, Ma. That sounded great. Good job, boys.
-See? I told you you could do it! -[laughs] -[Cutler] He did good. -All you gotta do is set your mind to it.
translation.ko: 할 수 있다고 했잖아! 의지만 있으면 할 수 있어

translation.en: -He did better than I thought he would. -My baby.
-Mwah. That's my baby. -Hey, boy. Hey, boys, Ma.
-Yeah! -Hey, let's do "Moonshine Blues" next?
"Moonshine Blues," boys.
Irv? Something happened with the recording. Check that mic.
translation.ko: 어빈, 녹음에 문제가 있어 마이크 확인해 봐

translation.en: One, one, one, two, check, one--
No. The problem's with the kid's mic.
Oh, Christ Almighty!
-Ma, we didn't record the song. -Shit!
What you mean you didn't record the song? What were you and Sturdyvant doing up there?
translation.ko: 그게 무슨 소리야? 일을 대체 어떻게 한 거야?

translation.en: [Irvin] Levee must have kicked the plug out.
I ain't kicked nothing.
If Levee had his mind on what he was doing.
If it ain't one thing, it's another. Straighten your black ass out.
translation.ko: 레비, 항상 네가 문제야 말썽 좀 그만 피워라

translation.en: Hell, it ain't my fault. I ain't done nothing. It's the cord, Mel.
translation.ko: - 내가 뭘 했다고 이래요? - 코드 문제네요

translation.en: The cord's all chewed up. We need another cord.
-The most disorganized… -[Irvin] Ma?
-[Ma Rainey] Waste of my time. -Where's she going?
-Shit. -[Irvin] Ma? Ma!
Ma?
If you walk out of this studio, you're through. You're washed-up.
translation.ko: 지금 가면 당신 끝장이야 끝물인 주제에...

translation.en: Chrissakes, Mel! Ma!
Ma, come back here! Ma, please!
Listen, Ma.
These records are gonna be hits.
They are gonna sell like crazy.
Hell, even Sylvester will be a star.
Fifteen minutes.
That is all I am asking, Ma. Just 15 minutes.
Fifteen minutes. You hear me, Irvin? Fifteen minutes.
Then I'm gonna carry my black bottom on back down to Georgia, you hear me?
Fifteen minutes. [scoffs]
[exhales] You boys go ahead and take a break. Fifteen minutes. We'll be ready to go.
Don't make no difference to me if she leave. I'm ready to get on outta here, anyway.
translation.ko: 마가 떠나든 말든 난 얼른 퇴근하고 싶어

translation.en: If I was Mr. Irvin,
I'd go on and get them cords and things hooked up right.
If Levee kept his mind on his work, we wouldn't be in this fix. We'd be up there finishing up.
translation.ko: 레비가 집중만 했어도 녹음은 진작 끝났어

translation.en: Now we gotta see if that boy can get that part right.
translation.ko: 이제 인트로 성공할 때까지 또 기다려야 하잖아

translation.en: He got one eye on the gal and the other on his trumpet.
translation.ko: 저놈이 여자애한테 정신이 홀딱 팔려서 그래

translation.en: [Cutler] Nigga, don't you know that's Ma's gal?
I ain't done nothing to her. I just talk to her like I talk to anybody else.
translation.ko: 난 다른 사람들한테 하듯이 말 한번 걸었을 뿐이에요

translation.en: Your ass gonna be out there scraping the concrete, lookin' for a job, you keep messing around with her.
translation.ko: 너 계속 그 아가씨 건드리면 막노동판으로 쫓겨나게 돼 있어

translation.en: I ain't done nothing to the gal. I just asked her her name.
If you sayin' I can't do that, Ma'll just have to go to hell.
translation.ko: 그것도 못 하게 할 거면 지옥에나 가라지

translation.en: I'm through with it. [scoffs] Try talking to a fool.
translation.ko: 난 관둘래, 이 바보는 답도 없어

translation.en: Some mens got it worse than others. Some mens is excited to be a fool.
translation.ko: 상태가 심각한 놈들이 있어 바보짓 하는 걸 즐기지

translation.en: I knows about it. The excitement is something else.
I done experienced it. Make you feel good to be a fool.
translation.ko: 이 몸도 겪어봤지 바보짓 하고 살면 기분은 좋아

translation.en: But it don't last long.
Over in a minute, then you got to tend with the consequences.
translation.ko: 얼마 못 가서 그 대가를 톡톡히 치르게 돼

translation.en: That's the best sense you made all day, talking about being a fool.
translation.ko: 자기가 바보짓 한 걸 인정하는 거네요

translation.en: That's the only sensible thing you said today, admitting you was a fool.
translation.ko: 오늘 아저씨가 한 말 중 유일하게 맞는 말이에요

translation.en: Oh, I admits it, all right. Ain't nothing wrong with it.
I done been a little bit of everything. [chuckles]
Gonna be a bit more things before I'm finished with it.
translation.ko: 아마 죽기 전에 더 하게 되겠지

translation.en: But I ain't never been the same fool twice. That's where we part ways.
translation.ko: 하지만 같은 실수는 두 번 안 해 그게 너와의 차이야

translation.en: But you been a fool. That's what counts.
Talking about I'm a fool for asking the girl her name, and here you is one yourself.
translation.ko: 그래 놓고 사람 이름 물어봤다고 날 바보 취급 해요?

translation.en: I married a woman. A good woman.
To this day, I can't say nothing bad about this woman.
I married her with all the good intentions and graces of being hooked up,
translation.ko: '내 삶을 그녀에게 바치리라' 그리 결심하고 결혼했어

translation.en: bound to her for the rest of my life.
Looking for this woman to put me in my grave, but she went out and joined the church.
translation.ko: 죽는 날까지 함께하려 했는데 아내가 교회에 다니기 시작했어

translation.en: She got up there and got to seeing them good Christian men
translation.ko: 그렇게 교회에 가서 착한 남자 신도들을 보고는

translation.en: and wondering why I ain't like that.
translation.ko: 난 왜 안 그런지 불만을 가지더군

translation.en: Soon she figured she hooked up to a heathen.
translation.ko: 자기가 이교도와 결혼했다고 생각하게 된 거지

translation.en: Couldn't live like that.
So she left.
I just sat down and I figured I was a fool
not to see that she needed something that I wasn't giving her,
translation.ko: 아내가 원하는 게 있다는 걸 눈치채지 못한 거지

translation.en: else she wouldn't have been up there at the church.
translation.ko: 내가 못 주는 걸 찾아서 교회로 향한 거니까

translation.en: So, yeah…
Toledo been a fool about a woman.
That's part of making life.
Toledo, what you call a fool and what I call a fool are two different things.
translation.ko: 털리도, 바보에 대한 정의가 나와는 다른 것 같아

translation.en: A fool is responsible for what happen to him.
translation.ko: 바보는 자기 잘못으로 인해 대가를 치르는 사람이야

translation.en: A fool cause it to happen. Like Levee.
He keep messing around with Ma's gal, his feet be out there scraping the ground.
translation.ko: 그 여자애한테 계속 집적대면 쫓겨날 걸 알면서 바보짓 하잖아

translation.en: -That's a fool. -Nothing gonna happen to Levee.
translation.ko: 그 여자애한테 계속 집적대면 쫓겨날 걸 알면서 바보짓 하잖아 그럴 일은 없을 거예요 내가 그렇게 안 둬요

translation.en: Levee ain't gonna let nothing happen to him.
translation.ko: 그럴 일은 없을 거예요 내가 그렇게 안 둬요

translation.en: Better not let Ma see you ask her. That's what the man's trying to tell you.
translation.ko: 마한테 들키면 어쩌려고 그래? 사람 말 좀 들어라!

translation.en: I don't need nobody to tell me nothing.
Toledo, all I'm saying is, from the looks of it,
from your story, I don't think life treated you fair.
Oh, life's fair.
Life ain't shit.
You can put it in a paper bag and carry it around with you. -It ain't got no balls. -[door clangs]
translation.ko: 봉투에 넣어 들고 다니면 찍소리도 못 하지

translation.en: Now death? Death got some style.
Death will kick your ass and make you wish you never been born.
translation.ko: 우리 궁둥짝을 걷어차고 태어난 걸 후회하게 만들거든요

translation.en: That's how bad death is.
But you can rule over life. Life ain't nothing.
translation.ko: 삶은 무시해도 돼요 삶은 뭣도 아니니까

translation.en: Nigga talking about life is fair and ain't got a pot to piss in.
translation.ko: 가진 거 쥐뿔 없는 사람이 삶이 공평하단 소리를 하네

translation.en: All right. Now I'm gonna tell you something.
A nigga gonna be dissatisfied no matter what.
Niggas got a right to be dissatisfied.
Is you gonna be satisfied with a bone somebody done throwed you
translation.ko: 누가 개뼈다귀 하나 던져주면 만족할 수 있겠어요?

translation.en: when you done seen them eating a whole hog?
You lucky they let you be an entertainer. You're lucky and don't even know it.
translation.ko: 넌 팔자 좋아서 음악 하잖아 그런데 뭐가 불만이야?

translation.en: I'm talking about being satisfied with a bone somebody done throwed you.
translation.ko: 남이 던져준 개뼈다귀에 만족하고 사는 게 문제라고요

translation.en: That's what's the matter with y'all, you're satisfied sitting in one place.
Soon as I get my band together and record them songs Mr. Sturdyvant done told me I can make,
translation.ko: 내가 밴드 만들어서 스터디밴트랑 녹음만 해봐요

translation.en: I'm gonna be like Ma and tell the white man just what he can do.
translation.ko: 마가 하는 것처럼 백인을 부리고 살 거니까

translation.en: Ma tell Mr. Irvin she leaving?
Mr. Irvin get down on his knees and beg her to stay.
That's the way I'm gonna be. Make the white man respect me.
translation.ko: 나도 그렇게 백인한테 존중받는 사람이 될 거예요

translation.en: The white man don't care nothing about Ma. The colored folks made Ma a star.
translation.ko: 백인들은 마를 존중하지 않아 마는 흑인들에게나 스타지

translation.en: The white folks don't care nothing about who she is or what kind of music she make.
translation.ko: 백인들은 마가 누군지 무슨 음악을 하는지 상관 안 해

translation.en: Let her go to one of them white folks hotel and see how big she is.
translation.ko: 백인들 노는 호텔 가면 명함도 못 내밀 거다

translation.en: [scoffs] Hell, she can't even get a cab up here in the North.
I'mma tell you something. Reverend Gates. Slow Drag, you know who I'm talking about. Reverend Gates.
translation.ko: 게이츠 목사 얘기를 해주지 그 사람 누군지 알지?

translation.en: Reverend Gates was, uh, coming up from Tallahassee to Atlanta
translation.ko: 게이츠 목사는 탤러해시에서 애틀랜타로 가는 중이었어

translation.en: to see his sister who was sick at that time with the consumption.
translation.ko: 결핵에 걸린 누이를 만나러 가고 있었지

translation.en: The train come up through Thomasville, then past Moultrie,
and then ended up in this little town called Sigsbee. You can stop telling that right there.
Ain't but one train come out of Tallahassee headed north to Atlanta.
translation.ko: 탤러해시에서 애틀랜타 가는 기차가 딱 하나 있는데

translation.en: It don't stop at Sigsbee.
The only train that stop at Sigsbee is the Santa Fe,
translation.ko: 식스비로 가는 건 샌타페이 기차밖에 없어요

translation.en: and you gotta transfer at Moultrie to get it.
Maybe that's what he done. I don't know.
I'm just telling you he got off at Sigsbee.
You telling it. Tell it your way. Just make up anything.
Leave him alone and let him finish. Go on, tell it your way.
Reverend Gates got off this train in Sigsbee.
Figured he'd check the schedule
to make sure he arrived in time for somebody to pick him up. All right?
translation.ko: 목적지에 도착해야 하니까 시간표를 보려고 했지

translation.en: While he's there, it come upon him that he had to go to the bathroom.
translation.ko: 그런데 시간표를 보다가 화장실에 가고 싶어진 거야

translation.en: Now, the only colored restroom they had
was an outhouse they had sitting way back, 200 yards or so from the train station.
While he's in the outhouse, the train go off and leave without him.
translation.ko: 그래서 화장실에 갔는데 그 사이에 기차를 놓쳐버렸어

translation.en: Now, he don't know where he is in this town.
translation.ko: 목사는 자기가 있는 곳이 어딘지도 몰랐어

translation.en: In fact, he ain't never heard of it before.
I heard of it, and he ain't got off no train
coming outta Tallahassee in Sigsbee.
The man's standing there trying to figure out what he gonna do,
translation.ko: 목사는 기차역에 서서 어떻게 할지 고민했어

translation.en: where this train done left him in this strange town.
translation.ko: 기차가 낯선 마을에 자길 두고 가버렸으니까

translation.en: It started getting dark.
He sees where the sun's getting low in the sky,
translation.ko: 목사는 하늘 저편으로 저무는 해를 보며

translation.en: and he's trying to figure out what he gonna do,
when he noticed a couple of white fellas standing across the street from the station.
translation.ko: 길 건너에서 자길 쳐다보는 백인 남자들을 발견했어

translation.en: Just standing there, watching him.
Then two or three more fellas come up and join the other one.
translation.ko: 조금 뒤에 두 명이 무리에 합류했어

translation.en: Now he look around the station. He don't see no colored folks nowhere.
He don't know what's getting into these fellas' minds,
translation.ko: 목사는 남자들 속을 알 수 없어서

translation.en: so he commence to walking.
He don't know where he walking. He walking down the railroad tracks
translation.ko: 아무 생각 없이 철길을 따라 걷고 있는데

translation.en: when he hear, "Hey, nigger."
Just like that.
"Hey, nigger."
He keep walking.
They call him some more. He kept walking.
translation.ko: 자길 부르는 소리를 무시하고 목사는 계속 걸었어

translation.en: Then he heard a gunshot. Yeah. He stopped then, you know.
translation.ko: 그러다 총성이 들리자 결국 발걸음을 멈췄지

translation.en: They crowded around him.
He's standing there,
cross around his neck,
and the little Bible that he keep with him all the time.
translation.ko: 손에는 성경책이 있었지 늘 갖고 다녔거든

translation.en: They ask who he was. He said he was Reverend Gates
and he was on his way to see his sister
who was sick, and the train went off and left him.
And they said, "Yeah, nigger?"
"But can you dance?"
He looked at them
and commenced to dancing.
One of them reached up and tore his cross off his neck,
said he was committing heresy by dancing with a cross and a Bible.
translation.ko: 성물을 들고 춤추는 걸 보니 이단이 틀림없다고 말했지

translation.en: Took his Bible and tore it up,
and had him dancing till they got tired of watching him.
translation.ko: 목사는 놈들이 지겨워할 때까지 계속해서 춤을 췄어

translation.en: -That's the only way that man-- -What I wants to know is, he a man of God.
translation.ko: - 그래야만 목숨을... - 이상하네, 그 사람 목사잖아요

translation.en: Where the hell was God when all this was going on?
translation.ko: 그 일을 당하는 동안 주님은 어디 있었죠?

translation.en: Why didn't God strike down them crackers with some of this lightning you talking about to me?
translation.ko: 왜 그 백인 자식들에게 벼락을 내리지 않은 거예요?

translation.en: Levee, you gonna burn in hell.
Why didn't God strike some of them crackers down? Tell me that.
That's the question. Don't come telling me this burning-in-hell shit.
translation.ko: 궁금하잖아요 지옥에 떨어진다는 둥 말 돌리지 마시고

translation.en: He a man of God,
why didn't God strike some of them crackers down?
I'll tell you why. I'll tell you the truth.
God ain't never listened to no nigga's prayers.
God take the nigga's prayers and throw them in the garbage.
God don't pay niggas no mind. In fact, God hate niggas.
translation.ko: 흑인은 안중에도 없어요 아니, 신은 흑인을 싫어해요

translation.en: Hate them with all the fury in his heart.
Jesus don't love you, nigga. Jesus hate your black ass.
translation.ko: 예수는 당신 안 사랑해요 흑인이라서 싫어하지

translation.en: Come talking that shit to me. Talking about burning in hell.
translation.ko: 지옥에 떨어진다느니 말 같지도 않은 소리나 하고

translation.en: God can kiss my ass.
You wanna blaspheme my God! That's my God! My God, you worthless--
translation.ko: 감히 내 신을 모욕해? 그분 건드리지 마, 이 쓰레기야!

translation.en: Let him go!
-You worthless! -Let him go!
-That's my God! Blaspheme my God. -Let it go! It don't mean nothing!
translation.ko: - 우리 주님 모욕하지 마! - 무시해, 그럴 가치 없어

translation.en: It don't mean nothing!
It's your God, huh? Is that right?
All right, I'm gonna give your God a chance. I'm gonna give your God a chance.
translation.ko: 내가 그 신에게 기회를 주지 기회를 줄 거야!

translation.en: I'm gonna give him a chance to save your black ass.
-Put that knife up! -Stay out of this, Toledo.
-That's no way to solve nothing. -Put that knife up!
I'm talking to Cutler's God! You hear me?
Cutler's God! I'm calling Cutler's God!
Come on and save this nigga.
Strike me down before I cut his throat.
translation.ko: 목 긋기 전에 나한테 벼락을 내려봐

translation.en: -You gonna burn in hell, nigga. -I'm calling your God.
translation.ko: - 지옥에 떨어질 놈! - 당신 신 불러주잖아

translation.en: I'm gonna give him a chance to save you. I'm calling your God!
translation.ko: 널 살릴 기회를 줄 거야 네 신을 부를 거라고!

translation.en: Cutler's God?
Come on and save this nigga.
Come on and save him like you did my mama.
Save him like you did my mama!
I heard her when she call you.
I heard her when she said, "Lord have mercy. Jesus help me."
translation.ko: 내가 똑똑히 들었어 '자비로운 주님, 날 살려주세요'

translation.en: "Please, God, have mercy on me, Lord. Jesus help me."
Did you turn your back?
Did you turn your back, motherfucker?
Did you turn your back?
Come on.
Come on and turn your back on me.
Turn your back on me!
Come on. Where is you?
Come on and turn your back on me!
Turn your back on me, motherfucker! I'll cut your heart out!
translation.ko: 무시해 봐, 개자식아! 내가 심장을 도려내 주마!

translation.en: Come on. What's the matter? Where is you?
translation.ko: 왜 안 나타나는데? 어디 있는 거야?

translation.en: Come on and turn your back on me.
Come on, what you scared of?
Turn your back on me! Come on!
Coward motherfucker!
Your God ain't shit, Cutler.
Your God ain't shit.
Wonderful. We got that, boys.
Good session, Ma. We've got ourselves some winners!
Slow Drag, where you learn to play that bass at? I heard it singing. I heard you.
translation.ko: 베이스 대체 어디서 배웠어? 베이스가 노래를 부르던데?

translation.en: You had that bass jumping all over the place. I was following Toledo.
translation.ko: - 날아다니는 줄 알았어 - 털리도한테 맞춘 거예요

translation.en: Nigga got them long fingers striding all over the piano.
-I was trying to keep up with him. -That's what you supposed to do.
-Play the music. -Cutler, you hear Slow Drag on that bass spanking like you spank a baby?
translation.ko: 아기 엉덩이 어루만지듯 저 베이스 만지는 거 봤어?

translation.en: Levee, what were you doing? Why you playing all them notes?
translation.ko: 레비, 넌 왜 그리 기교를 부리냐?

translation.en: Playing ten notes for every one you supposed to play. Don't call for all that.
translation.ko: 남들은 차분한데 너만 그러잖아 쓸데없는 짓 하지 마

translation.en: You're supposed to improvise on the theme. That's what I was doing.
translation.ko: 원래 테마에 맞게 즉흥 연주 하는 거잖아요

translation.en: You're supposed to play the song like I sing it.
[chuckling] The way everybody else play it.
I was playing the song the way I felt it.
I'm trying to sing my song and you messing up my ear.
translation.ko: 노래 좀 부르려는데 귀가 썩는 줄 알았네

translation.en: -You call that playing music? -Hey, I know what I'm doing.
Y'all back up and leave me alone about my music.
translation.ko: 내 음악 갖고 뭐라 하지 마요

translation.en: I done told you it ain't about your music. It's about Ma's music.
translation.ko: 네 음악 아니고 마의 음악이라고 했잖냐

translation.en: That's all right. I told you what to do. What I care about what you and Cutler do?
translation.ko: - 신경 꺼, 시키는 대로 안 해 - 댁들 말을 왜 들어야 돼요?

translation.en: Y'all gonna fire me. I don't care. I'll go get my own band anyway.
translation.ko: - 난 밴드 만들면 되니까 자르세요 - 계속 까불면...

translation.en: -You keep messing with me-- -Nobody studying you.
translation.ko: - 난 밴드 만들면 되니까 자르세요 - 계속 까불면... - 당신 생각 안 궁금해요 - 좋을 대로 해, 넌 해고야

translation.en: All right, nigga. You fired.
translation.ko: - 당신 생각 안 궁금해요 - 좋을 대로 해, 넌 해고야

translation.en: You think I care about being fired? I don't care.
translation.ko: 해고라고 하면 눈 하나 깜박할 줄 알아요?

translation.en: -You doing me a favor. -Cutler, Levee's out.
-He ain't playing in my band no more. -I'm fired? Good!
Best thing that ever happened to me.
I don't need this shit.
Okay.
Mel will be out with your money in a minute. That's cash money. I don't want no check.
translation.ko: - 멜이 돈 갖고 나올 거예요 - 현금으로 주시는 거죠?

translation.en: I'll see what I can do. I can't promise you nothing.
As long as it ain't no check. I ain't got no use for a check.
translation.ko: 수표는 안 받아요 그걸 어떻게 씁니까?

translation.en: Listen, Ma. I talked to Sturdyvant, and he said…
Now I tried to talk him out of it,
but he said the best he can do is take $25 of your money
translation.ko: 마 몫에서 25달러 빼서 실베스터에게 주는 게

translation.en: and give it to Sylvester.
Take what and do what?
If I wanted the boy to have $25 of my money, I'd give it to him.
translation.ko: 내 돈에서 주면 그건 내가 주는 용돈이지

translation.en: He's supposed to have his own money. He's supposed to get paid like everybody else.
translation.ko: 녹음에 참여한 대가를 따로 줘야 할 거 아냐

translation.en: You go on up there, and you tell Sturdyvant that he better pay the boy his own money.
translation.ko: 스터디밴트한테 가서 애한테도 돈 주라고 해

translation.en: -Yeah, I talked to him-- -[Ma Rainey] Talk to him again.
Tell him if he don't pay the boy his own money, he'll never make another record of mine again. Tell him that.
translation.ko: 애 돈 챙겨주지 않으면 다신 같이 작업 안 한다고 전해

translation.en: You supposed to be my manager. Always talking about sticking together.
translation.ko: 넌 항상 가수와 매니저가 서로 도와야 한다고 하잖아

translation.en: Start sticking.
-Get the boy his money! -Okay.
I'll see what I can do.
Hey, Ma.
Is there something wrong? Is there a problem?
I want you to pay the boy his money. Sure, Ma. I got it right here.
translation.ko: - 애한테 돈 줘요 - 그래야죠, 갖고 왔어요

translation.en: It's, uh, 200 for you and 25 for the kid, right?
Irvin misunderstood me. It was all a mistake. It was all a mistake.
translation.ko: 어빈이 내 말을 오해했어요 실수한 거죠
