translation.en: -A mistake, huh? -Sure, Ma. Made a mistake.
But he's paid, right?
The only mistake…
was when you found out I hadn't signed the release forms.
translation.ko: 내가 양도 계약서에 서명 안 한 걸 이제야 깨달았다는 거죠

translation.en: That was a mistake.
Come on. Sign the forms, huh?
-Dussie Mae, Sylvester, come on. -Ma, sign the forms.
[Ma Rainey] Irvin, where's my car?
It's right out front. I got the keys right here. Come on and sign these forms, huh?
translation.ko: 앞에 있어요, 열쇠도 있고요 마, 서류에 서명하세요

translation.en: Irvin, give me my keys.
Sure, Ma. Just… sign these forms.
Send them to my address. I'll get around to 'em.
Come on, Ma. I took care of everything, didn't I?
I straightened everything out.
Ma?
Please?
And you tell Sturdyvant,
any more mistakes and I can make my records someplace else.
translation.ko: 한 번 더 실수하면 다른 녹음실 알아볼 거라고

translation.en: [Cutler] I ain't gonna stand for it. Ain't gonna bring me no check down here.
translation.ko: 가만 안 있을 거야 수표로 주기만 해봐

translation.en: Man give me a check last time. What happened?
We had to go all over Chicago to get it cashed.
See a nigga with a check, first thing they think is he stole it.
translation.ko: 흑인이 수표 들고 나타나면 무조건 훔친 줄 알지

translation.en: I ain't had no trouble cashing mine. I don't visit no whore houses.
translation.ko: - 난 잘만 바꾸는데 - 매음굴에서 쓰니까 그렇겠지

translation.en: You don't know my business, so don't start nothing.
I'm tired of you as it is. I ain't but two seconds off your ass, noway.
translation.ko: 가뜩이나 지긋지긋한데 여차하면 혼쭐 내줄 거니까

translation.en: Don't y'all start nothing now.
What the hell I care what you're tired of? I wasn't talking to you.
translation.ko: - 이제 그만해라 - 지긋지긋하면 어쩔 건데? 너 말고 털리도에게 얘기한 거야

translation.en: -I was talking to this man. -Boys, I've got your pay.
translation.ko: 너 말고 털리도에게 얘기한 거야 돈 가져왔네

translation.en: Mr. Irvin told me you boys prefer cash, and that's what I have for you.
That was a good session you boys put in. There's 25 for you.
Yes, sir, you boys really know your business. Twenty-five for you.
We're gonna get you back in here real soon. Twenty-five.
And have another session, so you can make some more money.
translation.ko: 연주를 계속해야 돈도 계속 벌 수 있지

translation.en: And 25 for you.
[Levee] Uh, Mr. Sturdyvant, sir?
About them songs I give you?
Oh, yeah. Oh, Levee. Uh, I thought about it. I don't think that people will buy them.
translation.ko: 그래, 생각을 해봤는데 대중에게 안 먹힐 것 같아

translation.en: They're not the type of songs we're looking for.
Mr. Sturdyvant, sir. I done already got my band picked out.
translation.ko: 스터디밴트 씨 이미 밴드 멤버를 구해놨어요

translation.en: I got some real good fellas. They know how to play real good music.
translation.ko: 실력도 끝내주고 진짜 음악을 아는 친구들이에요

translation.en: I know if the peoples hear the music, they'll buy it.
Uh, Levee, I'll be fair with you. They're not the right songs.
Mr. Sturdyvant, peoples is tired of hearing jug-band music.
translation.ko: 이제 사람들은 저그 밴드 음악에 질렸어요

translation.en: The people in the big city? They want something with some fire to it.
Harlem, Detroit, DC.
Okay, I'll tell you what. I'll give you $5 apiece for 'em.
I don't want $5, Mr. Sturdyvant. I wants to record them songs like you say.
Like I say, they're not the kind of songs we're looking for.
translation.ko: 이미 말했지만 우리가 찾는 곡이 아니야

translation.en: Mr. Sturdyvant, you asked me to write them songs.
Why didn't you tell me that when I first give them to you?
translation.ko: 아까 악보 드릴 땐 이런 말씀 없으셨는데

translation.en: You told me you was gonna let me record them.
What's the difference between then and now?
-I'll pay you for your trouble. -What's the difference?
That's what I wanna know. I had my fellas play your songs.
When I heard them, they didn't sound like the kind I'm looking for right now.
translation.ko: 연주하는 걸 들어보니까 내가 찾던 음악이 아니었네

translation.en: You got to hear me play them.
You ain't heard me play them. That's what's gonna make them sound right.
translation.ko: 아직 안 들어보셨잖아요 제가 해야 느낌이 살아요

translation.en: Levee, I don't doubt that.
It's just that, I don't think they'd sell like Ma's records.
translation.ko: 솔직히 마의 음반만큼 잘 팔릴 것 같진 않아

translation.en: But I'll take 'em off your hands for you.
[chuckles] Mr. Sturdyvant, sir.
I don't know what fellas you had playing them songs,
translation.ko: 내 곡을 어떤 사람들이 연주했는지는 몰라도

translation.en: but if I could play them, I'd set them down in the people's lap.
translation.ko: 저한테 시켜주시면 사람들을 홀려놓을 수 있어요

translation.en: Now, you told me I could record them songs.
translation.ko: 저한테 시켜주시면 사람들을 홀려놓을 수 있어요 전엔 분명 녹음시켜 주겠다고 말씀하셨잖아요

translation.en: There's nothing I can do about that.
Like I say, it's $5 apiece. That's what I'll pay ya.
I'm doing you a favor.
If you write any more, I'll help you out and take 'em off your hands.
translation.ko: 앞으로도 곡을 써 오면 내가 사줄 수는 있네

translation.en: The price is $5 apiece. Just like now.
Hey, watch it, now.
Shit. You stepped on my shoe. Excuse me there, Levee.
Look at that.
Nigga, you stepped on my shoe.
-What you do that for? -Said I'm sorry.
You gonna step on my goddamn shoe. You done fucked up my shoe.
translation.ko: 왜 구두를 밟고 지랄이야? 완전 망가졌잖아요

translation.en: Look at what you done to my shoe, nigga.
I ain't step on your shoe. What you wanna step on my shoe for?
translation.ko: 난 아저씨 구두 안 밟았는데 왜 밟았냐고요

translation.en: Man said he was sorry.
How the hell he gonna be sorry when he done ruined my shoe?
Come talk about sorry.
Nigga, you stepped on my shoe, you know that?
-See what you done done? -I said, "Excuse me." Now it's over.
translation.ko: - 이거 보여요? - 난 사과했어, 끝난 일이야

translation.en: -What you want me to do, huh? -Wanna go and fuck up my shoe like that.
I ain't step on your shoe. Huh? Look at this.
translation.ko: 난 아저씨 구두 안 밟았잖아요 이거 보라고요

translation.en: -Okay, come on, now. -Naw, naw. Look at what you done.
translation.ko: - 하지 마라 - 아뇨, 아저씨 한 짓을 봐요

translation.en: Look at that. That's my shoe.
You did it. You did it!
You fucked up my shoe.
You stepped on my shoe with them raggedy-ass clodhoppers.
translation.ko: 그 헐어빠진 작업화로 내 구두를 짓밟았어!

translation.en: Ain't nobody studying about you and your shoe.
translation.ko: 너나 네 신발이나 누가 본다고 이러는 거냐?

translation.en: I said, "Excuse me."
If you can't accept that, then the hell with it.
translation.ko: 사과 못 받겠으면 그걸로 끝인 거야

translation.en: What you want me to do?
You stepped on my shoe.
He… He stepped on my shoe. He did.
Honest. Cutler, he stepped on my shoe.
What he do that for? Toledo, what you do that for?
translation.ko: 왜 그랬어요? 털리도, 대체 왜 그랬어요?

translation.en: Cutler, help.
He stepped on my shoe.
Cutler!
It's okay, Toledo. I'll help you.
Come on, Toledo.
Oh, no.
Don't…
Don't look at me like that.
Don't look at me like that.
